**Animate Armour** is a level 4 [Earth](/Earth "Earth")/[Summonings](/Summonings "Summonings") spell which brings forth your armour's spirit into battle as an **animated armour**. The heavier your armour, the stronger it will be.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Summons an animated armour, which has stats dependent on the base [AC](/AC "AC") of your body armour:

- HP: Base 40
- AC: `2 * AC`
- Attack: Hits twice for `AC + (AC * AC / 2)` damage.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- Extremely slow movement speed.
- Infinite [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower")
- Immunity to [poison](/Poison "Poison") and [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy")
- Is mindless and [flying](/Fly "Fly").

Other means of increasing [AC](/AC "AC") (whether from the armour's [enchantment](/Enchantment "Enchantment"), [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation"), or being a [Gargoyle](/Gargoyle "Gargoyle")) do not directly affect the spirit's stats.

There is a summon cap of 1 animated armour; casting the spell again will cause the old summon to very quickly time out.

[Draconians](/Draconian "Draconian"), [Felids](/Felid "Felid"), and [Octopodes](/Octopode "Octopode") cannot use this spell, as they cannot wear body armour. Neither can players in an armour-melding [form](/Transformation "Transformation"), though swapping forms or taking off your armour will not dispel the summon.

## Strategy

This spell is meant primarily for melee-caster hybrids, giving you an extra ally in melee. Even when created using the heaviest armour, the summon is relatively frail and will not win too many battles alone. High-stat characters, such as [Demigods](/Demigod "Demigod"), [Ogres](/Ogre "Ogre"), and worshippers of [Cheibriados](/Cheibriados "Cheibriados"), are the most likely to wear, and cast in, a suitable piece of armour.

The armour's strength scales heavily with its base AC; while a [robe](/Robe "Robe") may hit twice for up to 4 damage, the relatively light [fire dragon scales](/Fire_dragon_scales "Fire dragon scales") deals up to 40 damage per hit. A [crystal plate armour](/Crystal_plate_armour "Crystal plate armour") can deal up to 112 damage *twice* - but the huge effort required to cast *any* spell in crystal plate could have been used on something more effective than creating a single slow ally. Meanwhile, [quicksilver dragon scales](/Quicksilver_dragon_scales "Quicksilver dragon scales") synergize well: they have a high base AC, but very low encumbrance.

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), animated armours will gain resists innate to their base type.
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), animated armours did not [fly](/Fly "Fly").
- Animate Armour was added in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mon-util.cc:2100](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/mon-util.cc#L2100) (0.31.0)
